ResearchProjectDef.label: fruit leather
ResearchProjectDef.description: Dehydrate fruit, to lengthen its shelf-life. Requires careful control of the temperature and humidity.

ResearchProjectDef.label: insect meat
ResearchProjectDef.description: The bio-engineered insects on this planet have exceptionally tough, odious body tissues. You need to reprogram the machine to be able to process these things.

ResearchProjectDef.label: human meat
ResearchProjectDef.description: Cannibalism is more dangerous than eating other animals, because of the increased risk of parasites and disease-spread. The machine needs to be re-calibrated, with extra processing cycles, to make this safe to eat.

ResearchProjectDef.label: nutrient brick
ResearchProjectDef.description: Dehydrated, polymer-wrapped nutrient bricks were invented to keep people alive on long-haul cargo routes. Your "research" is actually breaking the fail-safe encryption codes, put there to keep people from eating this crud.

ResearchProjectDef.label: insect meat brick
ResearchProjectDef.description: Processing the insects inedible parts requires careful calibration, since they are so tough.

ResearchProjectDef.label: human meat brick
ResearchProjectDef.description: Processing human material into a stable polymer requires extra time, since it is so disease-prone.
